Data Structures¶

vrpSolver uses dictionaries to store different objects, such as nodes, arcs, roads, etc. One of the main reasons for doing so is that dictionaries does not require any additional python packages. Additionally, dictionaries can have flexible definitions of keys, so that the data used in vrpSolver can be used in other python packages that the user is using. In addition, two easy-to-use functions are provided (in common.py) for exporting and importing dictionaries. They are saveDictionary() and loadDictionary().

nodes¶

The nodes dictionary has to contain the location information of a node, additionally, it may include other information as follows:

  • ‘loc’: The location of the nodes in (x, y) or (lat, lon). In some functions, the key of ‘loc’ may be redirected by the locFieldName parameter.

  • ‘neighbor’: Polygons that are surrounding nodes. In the format of a list of points. This is particularly useful for the “close-enough” problems.
